forbidden: Never commit secrets, tokens, or credentials to code
Never write business logic in controllers
Never make direct SQL queries bypassing repositories
Never ignore checked exceptions (no empty catch blocks)
Never merge to master without passing tests
Never use System.out.println in production code
backend: Follow layered architecture: controller → service → repository
Use DTOs for API request/response, never expose domain entities directly
All service methods must be transactional where appropriate
Use dependency injection, avoid manual instantiation
frontend: Keep components small and focused (single responsibility)
Separate business logic from UI components
infrastructure: All configuration via environment variables or config files
Database migrations must be versioned and reversible
security: Validate and sanitize all user input
Use parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection
Encrypt sensitive data at rest and in transit
Implement proper authentication and authorization checks
testing: Unit tests required for all service methods
Integration tests required for all API endpoints
Use mocks for external dependencies in unit tests
custom_rules: Use record instead of POJO where possible
